sn4.3:1.4: Māra appears like the godlings of Susīma’s assembly (SN 2.29:10.2). It is not easy to know what gods to trust.
sn4.3:3.4: Paddhagū seems to be pa + addha + gū (or cara at SN 6.4:10.1), “one who travels in front”. They serve kings (Thag 13.1:1.2). The use of this term here suggests that they will not make Māra’s job easier for him by smoothing his path.
